title: What is Riot going to do about trolls in ranked games?
body: Have they given it any thought lately or am I going to have to endure these 'waste of time' games where someone goes 0/20 intentionally? Clearly the reporting system Riot has now is not working so I'd like to hear about a cool new kick system or loss prevention for all those feeders out there.

replies.body:
Had a Shaco support that took my Blue as I was starting Red buff as aatrox and then semi-fed bot lane. 
Once players started ignoring him as did I, he actually was somewhat helpful. We won match. Pissed me off though.

Nothing.

There is literally no plan to improve matchmaking at lower levels. Anything below gold 3 and you're on your own.

> We've begun testing a system capable of identifying gameplay toxicity like intentional feeders/trolls.
> In North America, for example, hundreds of intentional feeders are insta-banned after 2 games. We're slowly going to ramp up the system until it can detect more nuanced intentional feeding but right now, you rarely see intentional feeding like the old days with 5 Zeals and 0-20 scores.

Quoted from RiotLyte (post is brand new, too. just a couple days ago)
You can find a collection of posts about the issue on surrender@20.

Also,
> We're trying to get to a point where servers get all features at the same time, but it's pretty difficult in a game as massive as League. 
> Because the new systems are all tuned by cultural standards, each system is actually quite different and customized to a specific country. So, as we do beta-tests and launches we try to focus the team on 1 server at a time. If the beta-tests go well, we can start batching servers into groups and doing them all at once. But, for the first beta-test we want to be safe. 
> The first beta-tests tend to be on NA because that's just the timezone the team is in. For all other beta-tests like OCE the team has to be at the office like 2-5 AM.

>** Intentional Feeder Detection**
> 
> What about intentional feeders?
> 
> There is a separate system that focuses purely on feeders. If someone is feeding intentionally in multiple games then they will face temporary account suspensions and possible bans if they show no signs of reform.

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/L65wrRYe-player-behaviour-faq


When was the last time you had a player go 0/20?
I was exaggerating about 0/20 but in a game I just had my adc went 5/17 intentionally.

How exactly do you go **5**/17 intentionally?

Fact is they were trying at some point, the ones that go 0/20 are what get banned by the automated system, there is no system in place for someone who feeds "intentionally" cause they are bad.
He got 5 kills. He then got angry at someone who fed top lane. He then went top lane and stood under tower 17 times. That is how he went 5/17 intentionally. Pls.

Honestly, no exaggeration-- I was in a ranked game a few hours ago with some guy who claims he was given an account to "boost" and is thus going to intentionally feed/troll that person. He was giving out the account details in the champion select screen. He then proceeded to pick evelyn mid lane, and went 1/27 (the 1 wasnt intentional). 

He told the enemy team when we were doing baron, and was giving them tips on what to build to beat us. 

Funny enough we almost won that game because our Fiora managed to get insanely fed. But being 4v5 and giving the enemy team a free 27 kills eventually tipped the scales in their favour.

Lucky enough, though, the ranked server crashed or something once the game ended, and after being able to log back in a few hours later I see that the loss wasn't recorded.
